results.title: Big Henry and the polka dot kid
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Linda Gottlieb and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel ‘Luke Baldwin’s Vow’ by Morley Callaghan, about a ten year old orphan boy who goes to live with his aunt and uncle in rural Canada. Shows how the boy’s love for an old blind dog leads to conflict with his uncle who feels that the animal is impractical to keep.

results.title: Big H
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Australia Council and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An example to educators of what can be done to arouse and maintain children’s interest in the arts. Howard Spicer is known to thousands of school children all over Australia as “Big H” - the Operatic Bikie. Dressed in leather, he rides his motorbike into classrooms and introduces young people to opera. Using Spicer’s work as an example the film illustrates the concept of innovative arts. Suitable for secondary years 7-12, teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Big Gig
results.brief_description: A humorous driver training video which is directed at young drivers in need of more driving experience. The video, through the use of humour, science fiction and rock music, positively reinforces correct approaches to drinking. It covers issues such as the difficulties of night driving, the problems of peer group pressure and the effects of alcohol on driving.

results.title: Big city 1980
results.brief_description: In Big City 1980, host Garry Moore presents a discussion on how big cities might be seen in the future by contrasting two cities in the present, Brasilia and the redeveloping city of Philadelphia. The highlight of this program is the amazing futurist city of Brasilia, the capital of Brazil. This instant city was entirely built in a period of 5 years. Every street is an expressway and underpasses eliminate the use of intersections. It is a capital city where government buildings dominate, so this allows a unity in futurist architecture throughout, which looks like a giant set for a science fiction film. Important footage of the city is shown during its development stages. Lucio Costa won the competition for Brasilia’s master plan and Oscar Niemeyer designed the major government building. America’s first planned city of Philadelphia is also profiled along with the controversial plans of redevelopment, which will see the city into the future. Plans made by architects and designers of futurist cities are also shown towards the end of the program. This program was presented on the Tomorrow series by CBS News.

results.title: Big Ben
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The centenary of Big Ben and the history behind the famous chime. Prints from old editions of the “Illustrated London News” recall the casting and installation of the bell. Its significance as a symbol of hope during wartime is illustrated by a series of interviews. Commentary by James Mason.

results.title: Big and small
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Develops the concepts of comparative size by illustrating how children may measure common articles in relation to their own body size as well as by standard measuring units. Suitable for primary grade children.
